channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What happens now that the government has shut down. And, a pricing deal with Pfizer
item.description: The federal government has shut down for the first time since 2019. Mass layoffs have been threatened. And, President Trump announced a pricing deal w...

item.title: Where things stand with Trump's National Guard deployments
item.description: The Trump administration has deployed or threatened to deploy National Guard troops in more than half a dozen American cities that it says are crime r...

item.title: Greetings from Kyiv, where you might stumble across Zelenskyy taking a stroll
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Government shutdown could delay key economic reports at an especially sensitive time
item.description: The federal government shutdown, which began overnight, will delay key reports on the U.S. economy, including a monthly snapshot of the job market, wh...

item.title: PEN America warns of rise in books 'systematically removed from school libraries'
item.description: A new report says that the number of books being challenged or removed from public schools across the country has risen exponentially in the past two ...

item.title: 'It's safe now': See students pulled from rubble of collapsed school
item.description: Dramatic rescue footage shows the boys in Indonesia pulled to safety after their school collapsed.

item.title: Internet access returns to Afghanistan after Taliban blackout
item.description: A 48-hour shutdown imposed by the Taliban government hit firms, flights and risked further isolating women.

item.title: Activists say Gaza flotilla circled by Israeli warship
item.description: The Global Sumud Flotilla accused an Israeli vessel of steering "dangerously close" to one of its boats.

item.title: Supreme Court allows Lisa Cook to remain on Federal Reserve Board for now
item.description: A federal district ruled in September that President Trump's attempt to fire Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve Board of Governors was likely illegal.

item.title: Trump administration freezes $18 billion in infrastructure funding to New York
item.description: A top Trump administration official announced $18 billion in federal funds will be frozen for key New York City projects amid the government shutdown.

item.title: Danish PM calls for strong answer from EU leaders to Russia's hybrid attacks
item.description: Copenhagen is on alert as EU leaders discuss boosting their defences in response to disruption from drones and Russian war planes.

item.title: Sen. Mark Kelly warns millions face higher premiums if government shutdown continues
item.description: Sen. Mark Kelly joined "CBS Mornings Plus" to react to President Trump's speech to military leaders and new comments from Defense Secretary Pete Hegse...

item.title: Government shutdown begins as the nation faces a new period of uncertainty
item.description: Vice President JD Vance says Republicans want to resolve the health care issues that concern Democrats and led to the government shutdown but won’t ne...

item.title: Bronx high-rise partially collapses, entire side of building gone
item.description: An explosion rocked a Bronx high-rise Wednesday morning, causing the entire side of the 20-story building on Alexander Ave. to collapse.

item.title: Democrats embrace a shutdown fight in a rare moment of unity against Trump
Planned Parenthood clinics in Louisiana close
item.description: Planned Parenthood is now absent in four states — Louisiana, Wyoming, Mississippi and North Dakota.

item.title: Munich Oktoberfest to re-open after fatal house fire and bomb threat
item.description: The annual beer festival was closed for several hours because of possible links to an explosion and fire.

item.title: What happens now that a government shutdown is underway
